TypeSignature.Value: .class public sequential ansi beforefieldinit ExceptionHandlingClause extends System.Object

remarks.para: The class provides information about the clauses in a try…catch…finally block (Try…Catch…Finally in Visual Basic). To get a list of exception-handling clauses in a method, obtain a that represents the method. Use the method to obtain a object, and then use the property to get the list of clauses.

block.para: Working with exception-handling clauses requires a thorough understanding of metadata and Microsoft intermediate language (MSIL) instruction formats. Information can be found in the Common Language Infrastructure (CLI) documentation, especially "Partition II: Metadata Definition and Semantics" and "Partition III: CIL Instruction Set". The documentation is available online; see ECMA C# and Common Language Infrastructure Standards on MSDN and Standard ECMA-335 - Common Language Infrastructure (CLI) on the Ecma International Web site.

summary.para: Represents a clause in a structured exception-handling block.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

remarks.para: This constructor is invoked by derived classes during the construction of objects.

summary.para: Initializes a new instance of the class.

block.para: Working with exception-handling clauses requires a thorough understanding of metadata and Microsoft intermediate language (MSIL) instruction formats. Information can be found in the Common Language Infrastructure (CLI) documentation, especially "Partition II: Metadata Definition and Semantics" and "Partition III: CIL Instruction Set". The documentation is available online; see ECMA C# and Common Language Infrastructure Standards on MSDN and Standard ECMA-335 - Common Language Infrastructure (CLI) on the Ecma International Web site.

summary.para: Gets the type of exception handled by this clause.

remarks.para: A filter clause contains user-supplied Microsoft intermediate language (MSIL) that determines whether an exception is handled by this clause. For example, any clause containing the Visual Basic When keyword is a clause.

block.para: Working with exception-handling clauses requires a thorough understanding of metadata and MSIL instruction formats. Information can be found in the Common Language Infrastructure (CLI) documentation, especially "Partition II: Metadata Definition and Semantics" and "Partition III: CIL Instruction Set". The documentation is available online; see ECMA C# and Common Language Infrastructure Standards on MSDN and Standard ECMA-335 - Common Language Infrastructure (CLI) on the Ecma International Web site.

summary.para: Gets the offset within the method body, in bytes, of the user-supplied filter code.

block.para: Working with exception-handling clauses requires a thorough understanding of metadata and Microsoft intermediate language (MSIL) instruction formats. Information can be found in the Common Language Infrastructure (CLI) documentation, especially "Partition II: Metadata Definition and Semantics" and "Partition III: CIL Instruction Set". The documentation is available online; see ECMA C# and Common Language Infrastructure Standards on MSDN and Standard ECMA-335 - Common Language Infrastructure (CLI) on the Ecma International Web site.

summary.para: Gets a value indicating whether this exception-handling clause is a finally clause, a type-filtered clause, or a user-filtered clause.

block.para: Working with exception-handling clauses requires a thorough understanding of metadata and Microsoft intermediate language (MSIL) instruction formats. Information can be found in the Common Language Infrastructure (CLI) documentation, especially "Partition II: Metadata Definition and Semantics" and "Partition III: CIL Instruction Set". The documentation is available online; see ECMA C# and Common Language Infrastructure Standards on MSDN and Standard ECMA-335 - Common Language Infrastructure (CLI) on the Ecma International Web site.

summary.para: Gets the length, in bytes, of the body of this exception-handling clause.

block.para: Working with exception-handling clauses requires a thorough understanding of metadata and Microsoft intermediate language (MSIL) instruction formats. summary.para: Gets the offset within the method body, in bytes, of this exception-handling clause.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance string ToString() cil managed

summary.para: A string representation of the exception-handling clause.

returns.para: A string that lists appropriate property values for the filter clause type.

remarks.para: An integer that represents the total length, in bytes, of the try block that includes this exception-handling clause.
